verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
vaidarbhyāḥ sa tu sandeśaṁ
niśamya yadu-nandanaḥ
pragṛhya pāṇinā pāṇiṁ
prahasann idam abravīt

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; vaidarbhyāḥ—of the princess of Vidarbha; saḥ—He; tu—and; sandeśam—the confidential message; niśamya—hearing; yadu-nandanaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa, the descendant of Yadu; pragṛhya—taking; pāṇinā—by His hand; pāṇim—the hand (of the brāhmaṇa messenger); prahasan—smiling; idam—this; abravīt—said.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Thus hearing the confidential message of Princess Vaidarbhī, Lord Yadunandana took the brāhmaṇa's hand and, smiling, spoke to him as follows.
